adjectives.description: hotcha (comparative more hotcha, superlative most hotcha)

entries.meaning: (US, slang) Flashy, vivacious; attractive, desirable. [from 20th c.]
examples: ‘It seems he run Sternwood's hotcha daughter, the young one, off to Yuma.’

entries.meaning: (US, slang) 1930s jive slang term for (or related to) 'Harlem' hot rhythm music, esp. jazz,  [from 20th c.]
examples: ‘The passing of Harlem as a hotcha after-dark entertainment center, to a great extent, coupled with the drift towards Broadway of the Harlem spots.'
